dublinCore.dc:title: 119 S2021 IS: Close the Round-Tripping Loophole Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Wyden (for himself, Mr. Warner, Mr. Warnock, and Mr. Welch) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exclude round-tripped income for purposes of calculating global intangible low-taxed income, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Close the Round-Tripping Loophole Act.

section.header: Modification to determination of net deemed intangible income return

subsection.text: Section 951A(b)(2)(A) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking 10 percent of the aggregate of and inserting

quoted-block.text: 10 percent of the excess (if any) of—

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following new clause:

clause.text: an amount equal to the product of the amount determined under clause (i) and the round-tripping ratio, over

subsection.text: Section 951A(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

subparagraph.text: The round-tripping ratio means, with respect to any United States shareholder for any taxable year, the percentage (not greater than 100 percent) which is equal to the ratio which—

clause.text: the shareholder’s round-tripped net CFC tested income for such taxable year determined under subparagraph (B), bears to
the shareholder’s net CFC tested income for such taxable year, determined without regard to this paragraph.

subparagraph.header: Shareholder’s round-tripped net CFC tested income
subparagraph.text: For purposes of subparagraph (A)(i), a United States shareholder’s round-tripped net CFC tested income for any taxable year is the net CFC tested income of such shareholder which would be determined under subsection (c) for such taxable year if—

clause.text: the only income taken into account under clause (i) of subsection (c)(2)(A) in determining the tested income or tested loss of each controlled foreign corporation taken into account by such shareholder under subsection (c)(1) for such taxable year were income described in such clause which is derived in connection with—

item.text: which is sold by the taxpayer to any person who is a United States person, or
which the taxpayer cannot establish to the satisfaction of the Secretary is for foreign use, or

subclause.text: services provided by the taxpayer which the taxpayer cannot establish to the satisfaction of the Secretary are provided to any person, or with respect to property, not located within the United States, and

clause.text: the only deductions taken into account under clause (ii) of subsection (c)(2)(A) in determining such tested income or tested loss were deductions properly allocable to income described in clause (i).

subparagraph.text: For purposes of this subsection, the determination of whether property is for a foreign use shall be made in the same manner as under section 250(b).

clause.text: In the case of any United States shareholder described in clause (ii), the round-tripping ratio shall be 0 percent.

subclause.text: A United States shareholder is described in this clause if the average annual gross receipts of such United States shareholder for the 3-taxable year period ending with the taxable year which precedes such taxable year does not exceed $100,000,000.
Rules similar to the rules of paragraphs (2)(B) and (3) of section 59A(e) shall apply for purposes of this clause.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply taxable years of foreign corporations beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act, and to taxable years of United States shareholders in which or with which such taxable years of foreign corporations end.

section.header: Limitation on deduction for global intangible low-taxed income

subsection.text: Section 250(a)(1)(B) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: 50 percent of the excess (if any) of—

subclause.text: the global intangible low-taxed income amount (if any) which is included in the gross income of such domestic corporation under section 951A for such taxable year, and
the amount treated as a dividend received by such corporation under section 78 which is attributable to the amount described in subclause (I), over

clause.text: an amount equal to the product of the amount determined under clause (i) and the round-tripping ratio (as determined under section 951A(b)(3)) of such domestic corporation for such taxable year.

subsection.text: The amendment made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.
